text: The Dr. Jabez Campfield House, also known as the Schuyler-Hamilton House, is a historic, 4 bedroom Georgian-style house and museum located at 5 Olyphant Place, Morristown, New Jersey. It is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. With It is owned by the Daughters of the American Revolution. ==History== The house was built in 1760 and was purchased by Dr. Jabez Campfield and his wife Sarah Ward. The home is the place where Alexander Hamilton courted his wife to be Elizabeth Schuyler. ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Morris County, New Jersey ==References== == External links == * DAR Schuyler-Hamilton House (aka Campfield House) * Morris County Tourism Bureau * THE SCHUYLER - HAMILTON HOUSE, Rootsweb Category:National Register of Historic Places in Morris County, New Jersey Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in New Jersey Category:Historic house museums in New Jersey Category:New Jersey Register of Historic Places Category:Houses completed in 1760 Category:Morristown, New Jersey
title: Dr. Jabez Campfield House
